data.title: Again Dangerous Visions by Ellison, First Edition
data.meta_description: Again, Dangerous Visions: Volume 2 by Ellison, Harlan Â Editor and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Softcover. Condition: Good. Ed Emshwiller (illustrator). First Edition. Introduction by editor. The text is illustrated with black-and-white drawings by Ed Emshwiller. Colour illustrated paperback binding with black, orange and white coloured titles to the front panel and black and red coloured titles to the back strip. The second in a trilogy of works edited by Harlan Ellison featuring new wave science fiction. Authors include Dean R. Koontz, Gregory Benford and M. John Harrison. Rubbing of the book edges and panels with creasing of the corners stop tanning and marking of the text block edges; with, lighter tanning of the pages. Foxing to the verso of the covers with a bookseller's stamp (book exchange stamp) to the lower edge of the half title page. first publication by this publisher. Size: 12 mo (standard paperback). 448, [4 with three pages further titles from publishing house] pages, Please refer to accompanying picture (s). Illustrator: Ed Emshwiller. Quantity Available: 1. Shipped Weight: Under 1 kilo. Category: Science Fiction & Fantasy; Short Stories; ISBN: 0330250965. ISBN/EAN: 9780330250962. Inventory No: 0290991.

First edition. In original price clipped dust jacket. An anthology of 46 specially written original science fiction short stories from 42 writers - including Dean Koontz, Ray Bradbury, Ursula K. Le Guin, Gregory Benford and many more. Illustrated in b/w by Ed Emshwiller. Dust jacket is in a good condition with only minor shelf wear, and one very small chip to top at front. Inside, the book is very clean and fresh. Previous owner's gift message in pen to half title. Overall a great copy of the sequel to Ellison's speculative fiction collection from five years previous: Dangerous Visions. The book jacket's description closes by saying "This book takes off where Dangerous Visions stopped and it is a better book than Dangerous Visions". 830 pages. 225 x 145 mm (8¾ x 5¾ inches).

Hardcover. 8vo. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st edition. This ex library first edition copy remains in good condition with boards bound in black cloth with pointed corners. Dust Jacket is unclipped, protected in mylar and attached to the boards by the flap. Dust Jacket has shelf wear present such as some water damage, creases and couple tears along edges. Text block is slightly canted and toned. Binding is loose but intact. 755p. Interior contains matching deep blue decorative end pages and remains completely unmarked aside from library stamp on title page. Several pages towards the front are loose but remain attached, water damage and some foxing present on edges through out. Library pocket and cards remain on the rear end page.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. Ed Emshwiller (illustrator). First Edition. This is a Very Good Copy of this Book in Publisher's black cloth boards with gilt title lettering to spine blocked in purple in a Very Good Dust-wrapper that has some modest rubbing and wear along the outer extremities of the dust-wrapper.Not Price clipped (showing $12.95 to the front flap at top) The book has no former owner's names or inscriptions present.Binding of the book remains firm with no hinge weakness.Contents remain clean internally.Uncommon composition of 42 writers one of whom were in the First Anthology,the stories range from short 1,000 words to short novels of some 40,000 words and each story has it's own afterword by the Author.Thick 8vo 760pp First US Edition 1st Impression [1972].

Mass Market Paperback. Condition: Good. Ed Emshwiller (illustrator). First Thus 4th Printing. Light Creasing on Front, Rear Covers, Spine; Front, Rear Covers, Spine Lightly Chipped; Spine Slightly Cocked; Edges Moderately Soiled; Slight Yellowing Due to Age. Featuring: Ray Bradbury, Kurt Vonnegut, Jr., Ursula K. Le Guin, Piers Anthony, and others. CONTENTS: Introduction: An Assault of New Dreamers - Harlan Ellison; Keynote Entry: The Counterpoint of View - John Heidenry; Ching Witch! - Ross Rocklynne; The Word for World is Forest - Ursula Kroeber Le Guin; For Value Received - Andrew J. Offutt; Mathoms from the Time Closet - 1: Robot's Story; 2: Against the Lafayette Escadrille; 3: Loco Parentis - Gene Wolfe; Time Travel for Pedestrians - Ray Nelson; Christ, Old Student in a New School - Ray Bradbury; King of the Hill - Chad Oliver; The 10:00 Report is Brought to You by. - Edward Bryant; The Funeral - Kate Wilhelm; Harry the Hare - James B. Hemesath; When it Changed - Joanna Russ; The Big Space Fuck - Kurt Vonnegut, Jr.; Bounty - T. L. Sherred; Still-Life - K. M. O'Donnell; Stoned Counsel - H. H. Hollis; Monitored Dreams & Strategic Cremations - 1: The Bisquit Position; 2: The Girl With Rapid Eye Movements - Bernard Wolfe; With a Finger in My I - David Gerrold; In the Barn - Piers Anthony. SYNOPSIS: Few men know the science fiction scene as well as Harlan Ellison. Something here to expand everyone's consciousness. Size: 12mo - over 6¾" - 7¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First Edition. N7 gutter code at the rear. Near Fine in an about Very Good jacket, unclipped ($12.95), generally toned and rubbed, a few creases and small chips. Black cloth with a purple ink panel and gilt lettering on the spine. Firmly bound with a slight forward lean, clean internally. Just like its predecessor, Again, Dangerous Visions is a classic science fiction anthology edited by Ellison and featuring works from Ursula Le Guin, Gene Wolfe, Chad Oliver, Kate Wilhelm, Joanna Russ, Kurt Vonnegut, Thomas Disch, among others. This copy comes from the personal collection of noted science fiction fan, artist, and publisher John Stopa.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. 1st Edition. First English edition of the second installment in Ellison's groundbreaking anthology of New Wave science fiction, published four years after the American edition. First edition. Octavo, 8 3/4 x 5 3/4 in. xxiii, 760pp. Blue textured-paper boards, gold spine lettering; in dust jacket. Light bumping to spine ends. Mild soiling to boards. A few faint spots of soiling to textblock edges. In an unclipped ("£6.00") jacket with wear and some short tears at ends of mildly faded spine, an area of laminate lifting at base of front panel. Very good (+) in a very good jacket. Jacket design by Paul Redway.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Fair. Emshwiller, Ed (illustrator). 1st Edition. First edition with N7 code on p. 760, hardcover, signed by Gerrold at his entry. The binding is a loose but remains solid without cracks or pulling, and the book has bumps to the spine ends and cover corners, mild rubbing to the covers, spots of soiling to the fore and tail edges of the text block with very shallow bleeding onto the page faces, a previous owner's plate to the front fly leaf, and penned check marks to the Contents. Otherwise, this is a solid Good only copy in an unclipped, Fair dust jacket, which has bumps with chips and tears to the spine ends and corners, a few heavy vertical creases to the covers and flaps, rubbing and light soiling to the covers, sunning to the spine, and wear to the edges.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good-. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good+. Illustrated by Ed Emshwiller (illustrator). 1st Edition; State A. B&W Illustrations; First Edition, Currey's State A - with code N7 on margin of page 760, and NO statement of printing on the copyright page. (see Currey, page 179.) SIGNED EDITION. This copy has been signed by the author on the title page. Approximately 4500 of this state. This book is in Very Good- condition and has a Very Good+ dust jacket. This copy is in generally clean condition, with the exception of several patches of cracking to the front inner hinge. The text pages are clean and bright. The dust jacket is in generally clean, bright condition, though the white dust jacket is a little shy of crisp white than it could be. There are several small scuff marks to the spine joints, corners and flap joints. "Ellison continued to publish short fiction and nonfiction pieces in various publications, including some of his best known stories. "'Repent, Harlequin! ' Said the Ticktockman" (1965) is a celebration of civil disobedience against repressive authority. "I Have No Mouth, and I Must Scream" (1967) is a story where five humans are tormented by an all-knowing computer throughout eternity. The story was the basis of a 1995 computer game; Ellison participated in the game's design and provided the voice of the god-computer AM. Another story, "A Boy and His Dog", examines the nature of friendship and love in a violent, post-apocalyptic world and was made into the 1975 film of the same name, starring Don Johnson. " (from Wikipedia); Signed by Author.

Octavo, cloth. First edition. First printing with code "N7" on page 760. Signed on the title page by Ellison. Major original anthology with forty-six fictions by Ursula K. Le Guin, Thomas M. Disch, Gene Wolfe, Kurt Vonnegut, and many others. Includes "Moth Race" by Richard Hill, "Soundless Evening" by Lee Hoffman, "The Word for World is Forest" by Ursula K. Le Guin, "With the Bentfin Boomer Boys on Little Old New Alabama" by Richard A. Lupoff, "Ching Witch!" by Ross Rocklynne, "When It Changed" by Joanna Russ, "The Big Space Fuck" by Kurt Vonnegut, and "The Funeral" by Kate Wilhelm. Also, Piers Anthony's unpleasant meat-is-murder story "In the Barn." A bigger and equally fine sequel to Ellison's groundbreaking original anthology DANGEROUS VISIONS (1967). ". these books [DANGEROUS VISIONS and AGAIN, DANGEROUS VISIONS] were striking for the general excellence of their contents and for the extensive, deeply personal annotations supplied by HE." - Clute and Nicholls (eds), The Encyclopedia of Science Fiction (1993), pp. 378. Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-1335. Lower spine end soft, lower front corner tips lightly bruised, a bright, very good or better copy in good or better dust jacket with wear to lower spine end and clipped price. (#172768).
